>
[Zephyr Guard Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1154) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad](/Sources.aspx?ID=14) pg. 81</row>

**Archetype** [Zephyr Guard](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=35)

</column>

---

As a Zephyr Guard, you’re always vigilant against crime and threats to the city’s safety. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against attempts to [Palm an Object](/Actions.aspx?ID=67), [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=68), or [Conceal an Object](/Actions.aspx?ID=61) (including you’re [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) concealed objects). You become trained in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) and Katapesh [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8); if you were already trained, you become an expert instead.

**Special** You can’t select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Zephyr Guard archetype.

<title level="2">Zephyr Guard Dedication leads to...</title>
[Decry Thief](/Feats.aspx?ID=1155), [Know the Beat](/Feats.aspx?ID=1156), [Relentless Disarm](/Feats.aspx?ID=1157), [Unfazed Assessment](/Feats.aspx?ID=1158)
